channel.title: Effect sex has on people
channel.description:
this started in another thread but anyways what does everyone thing are the effects of sex besides the obvious well known ones.
I think it has negative effects when its premarital and should have laws banning premarital sex.
discuss.
ps. my keyboard is broken so im not going to type a lot. spacebar is broken so i have to c/p all my spaces.... it freak'n sucks. i cant game well now that i think about it i could just bind a different key for jump.

item.title: Effect sex has on people
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:51, topic:466300”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=579174.msg4152108#msg4152108 date=1352493378]

Ruby: No. I was referring to the younger group of people that have replied on this thread.

But they aren’t a majority, lol.

xryz is 20, l&p is 24 iirc, jme is 21, lilXCj is 18, I’m 17, imsuperman05 is 18, amy is 17, Kidpaparoach is 17.

Everyone besides you is over 17 lol

Sorry, wasn’t aware that you were a perfectionist and took everything to the most literal offense, I’ll speak very slowly and clearly next time so you understand.
[/quote]

I’m just saying. There isn’t really a younger audience here.

Also @justin I didn’t know you had posted in here before:P.[/quote]
don’t worry about what he thinks, every post I’ve read of his is rude or has sarcasm in it.

item.title: Effect sex has on people
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:38, topic:466300”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=579174.msg4150412#msg4150412 date=1352408707]

But not all to the extent of drugs or alcohol, maybe going out without their say so but nothing extremely serious.
[/quote]drugs/alcohol is an extreme yes, but we were talking about masturbation originally.

Now what parent is really going to tell their child "son, I don’t want you to masturbate for 2 weeks "

The argument is that the mutual respect between you and the authority should at least allow you to respect the request enough to attempt to fulfill it. Not simply push it aside because you have no respect for anyone.

So, you should respect the request of a mentor or parent asking you to not to do something because it may have consequences in a certain situation. In the case of a fighter, masturbation or sex before a fight may (or may not) cause him the fight. Just respect the fact that they have been in the situation before and probably know what they might be talking about.[/quote]

This guy knows exactly what he’s talking about.

@L&P, just because you don’t have the discipline to do such a thing doesn’t mean my fighters don’t have enough respect for me to do that. Every single one of them carries the biggest ego you could ever imagine alongside a huge sense of pride. Pride in how tough they are, pride in their bodies, pride in their life. They will do whatever it takes to win the fight or better themselves. Everyone wants to be the best and to be the best they need to listen to what I say and follow it. If I find one of my fighters has disobeyed and lied to me I just throw them out of the gym and they can go elsewhere, if they’re not serious about being the best they can be and lying to the person who’s teaching them then they don’t belong with the rest of my serious fighters.

TL;DR just because you don’t have the discipline don’t be so naive as to suggest no-one can.[quote=“tyb97, post:41, topic:466300”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=579174.msg4150676#msg4150676 date=1352420090]
effect sex has on people…

i wouldn’t know :foreveralone:
[/quote]
Don’t worry a majority of this thread hasn’t either, even though they have claimed too.[/quote]

What gives you the right to say that, lol? Most people here are 17/18+ and you don’t know them IRL so what would make you have the right to say that? I sincerely hope you’re not one of those idiots who thinks just because someone knows how to program and likes runescape that it automatically makes them into someone who is a general “geeky-type” person.

Read full topic

I still say your insane.[/quote]
I busted out laughing at this point.

Read full topic

item.title: Effect sex has on people
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

respect authorities request to not masturbate for 2-3 weeks?

I still say your insane. You haven’t shown any proof that they follow that order. As I stated earlier, unless you watch them at night like a pedo to make sure nothing happens you have absolutely no way of knowing.

I can also bet you probably that at least one of the fighters would not obey it.

Read full topic

item.title: Effect sex has on people
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:36, topic:466300”][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=579174.msg4150321#msg4150321 date=1352405404]
But not all to the extent of drugs or alcohol, maybe going out without their say so but nothing extremely serious.
[/quote]drugs/alcohol is an extreme yes, but we were talking about masturbation originally.

Now what parent is really going to tell their child "son, I don’t want you to masturbate for 2 weeks "[/quote]
The argument is that the mutual respect between you and the authority should at least allow you to respect the request enough to attempt to fulfill it. Not simply push it aside because you have no respect for anyone.

So, you should respect the request of a mentor or parent asking you to not to do something because it may have consequences in a certain situation. In the case of a fighter, masturbation or sex before a fight may (or may not) cause him the fight. Just respect the fact that they have been in the situation before and probably know what they might be talking about.

jme:

I don’t think that it’s bad parenting if a teenager doesn’t listen to his parents. I got into drugs as a teen, but that’s in no way due to poor parenting, it was because I was a concious human being making my own descisions, which were poor.

Thanks for the point of view, but wouldn’t you also attribute your decisions to the way your parents raised you? It may have not be “poor parenting”, but your decisions reflect your parents in the eyes of other people. Socially, there’s no way to avoid people trying to blame parents for their children even if the child is aware of the consequences of their actions.

While I think you’re correct, in a sense, I can’t help but think about how others would see that.

Read full topic

item.title: Effect sex has on people
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:33, topic:466300”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=579174.msg4149831#msg4149831 date=1352381326]

[quote author=LilXCj link=topic=579174.msg4149265#msg4149265 date=1352348869]

LP, I don’t see why you have a hard time understanding the concept of not masturbating. Plenty of people do. Hell, I usually find myself stopping for a month or even longer. No one has that much sexual urge to just masturbate all the time.

Trying to understand the concept of mutual respect between people of higher ranking must be hard for you as well. Let’s put in a hypothetical scenario that you may or may not understand.

A 16 year old boy is going to a party. His father tells him not to get in trouble and don’t do drugs or drink. The mutual respect between the boy and his father should allow him to deny any of the aforementioned substances or getting into trouble. It’s simply expected, not required. Because the outcome of doing the opposite is generally bad for the person in subjective ways. In this case, the child gets punished if he gets caught.

It’s not about “well, he shouldn’t have gotten caught” its that he shouldn’t have been doing it anyway. He should wait 'til he’s of legal age to make those types of decisions.
[/quote]one thing, when you tell a teenager don’t do drugs they going to go do the total opposite.

/facepalm

In the case of your upbringing, maybe. I don’t know you that well so I can’t say. In mine, I have never done drugs. Why? My parents told me not to. Everyone is different.
[/quote]I’m sure upbringing has a certain percentile of course but I am talking in general here as well. Let’s be honest here in the teenage years ( especially the younger ones ) teens are point blank, rebellious, they rush into things, and a lot of times don’t use logic.

Teens may be rebellious but they aren’t so that they wouldn’t listen to what their parents had to say at all. That just makes the parenting bad.[/quote]

I don’t think that it’s bad parenting if a teenager doesn’t listen to his parents. I got into drugs as a teen, but that’s in no way due to poor parenting, it was because I was a concious human being making my own descisions, which were poor.

Read full topic

item.title: Effect sex has on people
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Pre-marital sex is NOT bad. Sex is proven to be healthy for humans (unless your having protected sex with someone that has HIV or something…). I’m pretty sure its healthy from the age of 13+, I’m not saying do it if your 13+.
Their are some social negative effects like lower morals but hey, who gives a shit about morals.
But in regards to your actual thread name, sex does have a negative affect on people because of the things people do to get it at times… But of course the positives outweigh the negatives.
offtopic but in regards to posts in the thread:
Your testosterone levels don’t constantly build up from not using your dick… You’d have constant blue balls (look up the term if you don’t know what it means) if it did. Testosterone makes you more athletically capable along with other things.
When a males horny, more testosterone than usual is released into the males system making him more athletically capable for a period of time.
Having sex right before something of course would tire you out but if you had it long enough [or wanked etc] before the event you’d perform better.

3 weeks of no sex+fapping would make my old rabbit (</3) be more aggressive in a fight, not me - it’d make me sexually frustrated but thats about it, maybe a bit pissy at worst. We’re humans, we’re not that low a calibre of mamel.

Read full topic

item.description:

LilXCj:

Sex has negative effects on athleticism from what I’ve read.

Trying to understand the concept of mutual respect between people of higher ranking must be hard for you as well. Let’s put in a hypothetical scenario that you may or may not understand.

A 16 year old boy is going to a party. His father tells him not to get in trouble and don’t do drugs or drink. Because the outcome of doing the opposite is generally bad for the person in subjective ways. In this case, the child gets punished if he gets caught.

It’s not about “well, he shouldn’t have gotten caught” its that he shouldn’t have been doing it anyway. He should wait 'til he’s of legal age to make those types of decisions.
